tweets.html:
Viewers of future dramas set in the 21st century's first two decades may not find it credible that the characters talk so much abt TV shows.

— Benjamin Kunkel (@kunktation) June 3, 2013

Why is everyone so convinced The Newsroom promo is metaphorical? Broadcasting from the desert, free from influence, is classic Will McAvoy.

— Scott Tobias (@scott_tobias) June 3, 2013

"I don't care for period dramas." --the loneliest girl on Twitter on Sunday night

— Nell Scovell (@NellSco) June 3, 2013

America leads the world in reality shows about what female reality show stars do after their reality shows end.

— John Fugelsang (@JohnFugelsang) June 3, 2013

This is why CBS in No. 1 (ok, not really): The Eye will begin primetime tonight w/ a note mourning the death of Jean Stapleton. #classy

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) June 3, 2013

Is there particularly a reason I should care about this Deadline/Wrap beef? It's like Mean Girls but with people who should know better.

— Bilal Mian (@Bilal_Mian) June 3, 2013

My decision to jokingly refer to The Wrap as "The Crap" is likely the apex of human cleverness.

— Fake Nikki Finke (@Fake_NikkiFinke) June 3, 2013

Nikki Finke is an amazingly Dickensian name for an unethical gossip journalist.

— Daniel Walters (@danieltwalters) June 3, 2013

I...I...can't. My chest. Hurts. Call. Paramedics. #orphanblack

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) June 3, 2013

Needle off the goddamn record. Time out. Flag on the play. All the expressions. All the expressions. ALL THE EXPRESSIONS. #orphanblack

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) June 3, 2013

#OrphanBlack just earned its name. Of course it is. OF COURSE IT IS. CHRIST ON A CRACKER.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) June 3, 2013

Things we keep being told are coming, but probably aren't:
• Winter
• Godot
• The Vengabus

— Ivor Tossell (@ivortossell) June 3, 2013

Can't believe this issue was never explored on Friday Night Lights. RT @UberFacts: It is illegal to graffiti someone else's cow in Texas.

— Sarah Watson (@SarahWatson42) June 3, 2013

I think last night's MAD MEN was a meta-commentary on what Don's life will be like in syndication, a hashish dream of eternal repetition.

— Jeffrey Sconce (@JeffreySconce) June 3, 2013

"The Democrats are dead. Not just now. Maybe forevever! Ha ha ha. By the way, have I mentioned it's the '60s?" #MadMen

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) June 3, 2013

Bob Benson, you're adorable. Please don't turn out to be a mass murderer. #MadMen

— mesk (@_mesk) June 4, 2013

I think I've waited the past four years for a Peggy & Joan plot that cool. Rest of the ep was okay, but holy shit, P&J 4 Life. #MadMen

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) June 3, 2013

Confession: Whenever I hear the SVU narration say that "sexually-based offenses are especially heinous," I hear it in the Bill & Ted voice.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) June 4, 2013

BBC reports first confirmed fatality in Turkish protests. Meanwhile, CNN has @piersmorgan interviewing Jesse Ventura.

— Harold Itzkowitz (@HaroldItz) June 4, 2013

We're the Writers Guild for fuck's sake. It's not our job to tell you what the best shows are, it's our job to fucking make them.

— Amy Berg (@bergopolis) June 4, 2013

The under-30 employment situation would be dramatically different if "How much of Mean Girls can you quote?" was a common interview question

— Aaron Fullerton (@AaronFullerton) June 4, 2013

Can we talk about the other Red Wedding from Sunday? That on #RHONJ Joe Gorga said "inedible" when he meant "inevitable"?

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) June 4, 2013

Still pretending that #Mistresses is a flash sideways in which Sun is cheating on Jin. #Lost

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 4, 2013

If you're watching #Mistresses, I'll give you cookies if you go to Sundance and watch #PushGirls instead.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 4, 2013

Um, WHAT? No helicopter??? This one-on-one date is BOGUS #TheBachelorette

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) June 4, 2013

Bryden the vet flipped a truck, cracked a rib, banged up his face and permanently paralyzed his sense of irony. #bachelorette

— Jennifer Weiner (@jenniferweiner) June 4, 2013

Every time one of the guys speaks, a book goes "never met him." #bachelorette

— Damian Holbrook (@damianholbrook) June 4, 2013

#TheBachelorette application form: Please check all that apply:
_ Deadbeat dad
_ Drug addict mom
_ Car accident
_ Diabeetus
_ Divorce

— Sara Schaefer (@saraschaefer1) June 4, 2013

"It's nice to have Soulja Boy here to guide everything that's going on." -- A sentence that was just said on #TheBachelorette.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) June 4, 2013

I was really afraid #TheBachelorette would end with the rap video, and then it did, and then it was the worst thing ever.

— Cassie Belek (@cassiebelek) June 4, 2013

Naming your son Ryden or Brooks is like submitting his audition tape for 'The Bachelorette' moments after he's born.

— Jordan Peele (@JordanPeele) June 4, 2013

In order to get killed on #TeenWolf you have to have at least one Abercrombie photo shoot in your portfolio.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 4, 2013

"What is even happening?" Yep, I just started watching the #TeenWolf premiere.

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 4, 2013

There's no way actually watching #TeenWolf would be more enjoyable than reading livetweets about it.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 4, 2013

OH MY GOD. These shirtless boys just....entered each other. #TeenWolf #OHMYGOD

— Carrie Raisler (@TVandDinners) June 4, 2013

A fantastic 7-game series, and yet THIS might be the lasting image. http://t.co/nd1eAeI3UY

— Pete Byrne (@PeteByrneWSBT) June 4, 2013

Apologies to non-Revolution followers. Tonight's the finale so it's gonna walk down my TL like a proud contestant on RuPaul's Drag Race.

— Linda H (@bookdal) June 4, 2013

Season finale of #Revolution. I'm full of whiskey, coffee and 19 episodes of frustrated expectations. BRING IT ON, MOTHERFUCKER.

— Deck The Hal-Les (@Lesismore9o9) June 4, 2013

@Lesismore9o9 *power goes out*

— Andrew Seroff (@Aseroff) June 4, 2013

How is #Revolution ending tonight? Is it the member of the NBC family that always shows up late to parties and then stays too late?

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) June 4, 2013

Where is Walder Frey when you need him? #Revolution

— battling bard 🎄❄️ (@katetocci) June 4, 2013

"The power's on. Now I can finally find out if my NCIS spinoff got picked up!" -Kim Raver #Revolution

— (((Andrew Rabin)))📎 (@arrabin56) June 4, 2013

I'm glad Aaron said "It Worked" and not Elizabeth Mitchell, otherwise I would have trashed my apartment in a hurricane of rage. #Revolution

— battling bard 🎄❄️ (@katetocci) June 4, 2013

I would've had to move. My landlord would be all "what the hell happened?" And my only reason would be "ill-advised tv homage?" #Revolution

— battling bard 🎄❄️ (@katetocci) June 4, 2013

Can someone with knowledge of the Game of Thrones books tell me how many more years I will have to endure hearing about this shit?

— Max Dawson (@fymaxwell) June 3, 2013

Woo hoo, @sepinwall had to close comments because of jackasses posting GoT spoilers! Great job, The Worst of Human Nature, you did it again!

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) June 3, 2013

@poniewozik @sepinwall Dumbest explanation someone offered: This is just how people grieve, man!

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) June 3, 2013

@poniewozik @tvoti That's why funerals are so sad. You're always, like, finding out about the end of The Sixth Sense and stuff.

— Linda Holmes (@nprmonkeysee) June 3, 2013

Always hire union minstrels. #GameOfThrones

— Ken Plume (@KenPlume) June 3, 2013

Describing #GoT to non-fan: It'd be like if Don Draper was getting annoyed with Roger, and just suddenly beheaded him. And Peggy. And Joan.

— Tommy "Keep Christ In" Christopher (@tommyxtopher) June 3, 2013

It's hard out there for a Stark. #whatIvelearnedaboutGOTtoday

— Jennifer Schaefer (@jlschaefer) June 3, 2013

The nausea passed, and what remained was burning, seething rage.#gameofthrones

— Eli Dardis (@Eli_Dardis) June 3, 2013

tweets.author_name: cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future
tweets.html:
My heart goes out to all the customer service operators that had to deal with people calling to angrily cancel HBO today. #GameOfThrones

— cybernetic sarCC of xmas past from the future (@sarCCastro) June 4, 2013

DEAR CHRIST!!!!!!!!!!!! God in heaven. What the FUCK IS HAPPENING??? They just killed have the fucking cast!!!! #GameOfThrones

— Retta (@unfoRETTAble) June 4, 2013

I can't delete this episode off my DVR fast enough. Disgusted with R. R. Martin and everything he stands for.#GameOfThrones

— Retta (@unfoRETTAble) June 4, 2013

I can't wait for Ben and Donna arguing about GOT on next season's Parks. "It was a subversion of fantasy tropes!" "IT WAS THE WORST THING"

— Rowan Kaiser (@RowanKaiser) June 4, 2013
